snippet: The Obama administration has been more reluctant to reveal its own secrets than it was in revealing Bush administration policies.
abstract: News analysis; disclosure of Justice Department document offering detailed legal analysis of Obama administration's targeted killing of American citizen and terrorism suspect Anwar al-Awlaki in 2011 has renewed debate about whether and when a president can order execution of a citizen based on secret intelligence and without any trial.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and CHARLIE SAVAGE

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration has been more reluctant to reveal its own secrets than it was in revealing Bush administration policies.

headline.seo: Obama Slow to Reveal Secrets on Targeted Killings
headline.main: Report on Targeted Killing Whets Appetite for Less Secrecy
headline.print_headline: Report on Targeted Killing Whets Appetite for Less Secrecy
